intro: Pentacalia vargasiana, commonly known as the Vargas mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
